meanings.sent1: Don't be a thickhead and touch the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the thickhead for not paying attention in class.
meanings.sent3: The thickhead thought the moon was made of cheese!
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him a thickhead when it came to trying new things.
meanings.sent5: Being a thickhead can lead to making silly mistakes.

meanings.sent1: The thickhead couldn't understand the simple instructions.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the thickhead of the group due to his slow understanding.
meanings.sent3: The thickhead tried to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent4: His thickhead nature made it hard for him to see the truth.
meanings.sent5: The thickhead's stubbornness was like a wall blocking new ideas.
